content.description: On the boulder that didn't fall into the wash, climb the wider bulge between two depressions start with high hands above the white dog bone shaped foothold. Many chunky holds to choose from.(Not listed in Rock Jock's Guide)Downclimb: faster to downclimb the problem and jump to the pads, but can also downclimb the long narrow (mildly exposed) slab on the west end of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder at west end of area.

content.description: On the boulder that didn't fall into the wash, climb the middle of the overhanging face from a sit start, left hand on big flat triangular edge, right on deep 4-finger edge. A fun cruise over the overhang, once you figure out how to get off the ground.(Not listed in Rock Jock's Guide)Downclimb: faster to downclimb the problem and jump to the pads, but can also downclimb the long narrow (mildly exposed) slab on the west end of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder at west end of area, east face.

content.description: On the boulder that didn't fall into the wash, climb the narrower bulge right of a depression, left of a plant growing on the side of the boulder. Start with left hand at large dish, right on a chunky 4-finger hold down right, and head straight up. Try to avoid destroying the plant, and the large dark flake above plant is loose, so also avoid that as well.(Not listed in Rock Jock's Guide)Downclimb: faster to downclimb the problem and jump to the pads, but can also downclimb the long narrow (mildly exposed) slab on the west end of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder at west end of area.

content.description: On the boulder that didn't fall into the wash, climb the mild arete from a sit start, passing the left side of the large scoop up top.(Not listed in Rock Jock's Guide)Downclimb: faster to downclimb the problem and jump to the pads, but can also downclimb the long narrow (mildly exposed) slab on the west end of the boulder.
content.location: Boulder at west end of area, east face.

content.description: A few feet left of the crack on north face, sit start and climb highly featured face.Problem #368 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P0.
content.location: Left of crack/low section on north face, freestanding boulder in middle of area.

content.description: Sit start and climb past a very large pocket.Problem #367 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.location: Right end of north face, freestanding boulder in middle of area.

content.description: Sit start left of the bush, right of the depression/scoop. Climb up the chunky holds.Problem #366 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P0.
content.location: South face, left end, of freestanding boulder in middle of area.Â

content.description: Sit start right of the bush using the massive oval pocket, head straight up.Problem #365 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.location: South face, just left of center and right of a bush, on freestanding boulder in middle of area.

content.description: Sit start at the scoop on right side of SW face and climb up through it.Problem #363 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: Right side of SW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Climb up and over from a sit start at two holds on SW face, left of the scoop.Problem #362 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.location: Left side of SW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Sit start at the two positive holds next to each other. A heel hook out left and footholds under the overhang with help get you off the ground. Head right to the big pocket, then head up.Problem #361 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.location: Right side of NW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Sit start and climb the big bulge with big holds in the middle of the face.Problem #360 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.location: Center of right half of NW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Start at the obvious knob about 6 foot high a few feet left of the crack/center of NW face. A long move will get you to the nice edges higher up.Problem #357 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: A few feet left of the crack/center of NW face on the boulder at the east end of area.

content.description: A couple feet right of the huge edge/slot noted in RJG #355, start with high good hold for left hand, right on a dish/sloped pocket, and hike the feet up, then hike them up some more, and commit to moving them one more time... then rock up for the good holds at the top.Problem #356 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.location: Center of left half of NW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Sit start and climb past several small pockets and one large pocket on the face between the left arete and bulge to the right (arete and bulge are off).Problem #359 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.
content.location: Next to arete on right half of NW face of boulder at east end of area.

content.description: Start with holds just above a huge sloped edge/slot, right using good high pocket, left on a not-obvious-until-you-grab-it good hold down left of the pocket. Head straight up through the depression in the rock.Problem #355 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: Freestanding boulder at east end of the area, left side of NW face.

content.description: Climb the rounded arete/right side of the narrow NE face at the end of the boulder.Problem #354 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.protection: Pad, maybe a spotter if at your limit.
content.location: Freestanding boulder at east end of the area, right side/rounded arete of NE face.

content.description: A few free-standing boulders (plus one that fell into the wash).Note: The boulders are on top of "shelves", so an extra pad folded in half to level out the main landing pad is beneficial for many problems in this area.
